ygData.subject: Re: BroadScope Crawl and out of memory error
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks a lot for running the crawl on your machine Michael. I was out of town so could not reply to you earlier. But yesterday I installed latest java 1.5

Thanks a lot for running the crawl on your machine Michael. I was out
of town so could not reply to you earlier. But yesterday I installed
latest java 1.5 version and things are running smoothly. I started a
crawl yesterday using latest Heritrix 1.3 head version and with 512M
of heap + 50 threads. More importantly crawl is still running today
and did not face any OOME yet. 

Thanks again for your help.

-saurabh

> > but will
> > > > > > often be
> > > > > > unable to proceed in any meaningful way, depending on what
> > > > operation was
> > > > > > prevented by the OOM.

> > > > > > Is the web UI responsive, and can you get a thread report?
> > > > > >
> > > > > > I notice a custom Processor, and HTML parser, in ToeThread
#34. It
> > > > would
> > > > > > be interesting to see what URL that thread is working on, and
> > for how
> > > > > > long.
> > > > > > It, or other custom code that's growing a data structure as
> > the crawl
> > > > > > proceeds, could be the cause of the OOM. Our stock crawler
> > components
> > > > > > might
> > > > > > hit an OOM for any broad crawl eventually, but typically
not so
> > > > soon with
> > > > > > such a large heap.
